meanings.definition: Having a visible sign or indication
meanings.sent1: The map had a marked trail for hikers to follow.
meanings.sent2: Her excitement was marked by a big smile on her face.
meanings.sent3: The cat's marked interest in the moving laser pointer was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The impact of the storm was marked by fallen trees and power outages.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's marked enthusiasm for science made the subject come alive for the students.

meanings.sent1: The smell of fresh cookies was marked in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: His disappointment was marked by a frown on his face.
meanings.sent3: The marked absence of birds in the park was quite unusual.
meanings.sent4: The impact of her words was marked by the silence that followed.
meanings.sent5: The marked improvement in her grades brought a smile to her face.

meanings.definition: To make a visible impression on
meanings.sent1: She marked her initials on the tree trunk with a heart around them.
meanings.sent2: The accident marked the road with skid marks.
meanings.sent3: He marked his territory by placing a 'No Trespassing' sign.
meanings.sent4: The artist marked the canvas with bold strokes of color.
meanings.sent5: The memory of that day marked her heart forever.

meanings.sent1: Please mark the date of the meeting on your calendar.
meanings.sent2: The sign marked the entrance to the hiking trail.
meanings.sent3: His red shirt marked him as part of the volunteer team.
meanings.sent4: The bell ringing marked the end of the school day.
meanings.sent5: The trophy marked her achievement in the competition.

meanings.sent1: The special badge marked him as a VIP guest.
meanings.sent2: The unique design marked the product as a limited edition.
meanings.sent3: Her kindness marked her as a true friend.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins marked the historical significance of the area.
meanings.sent5: The rare flower marked the beauty of the garden.
